column2: We are seeking experienced Civil Engineering Designers / AutoCAD Architects to join our team      The successful candidates will work closely with US-based companies across the construction sector      The candidate should have strong proficiency in AutoCAD and preferably practical experience working for US-based companies      If you have a passion for design and are eager to learn and grow in a collaborative environment, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity                    Job Description:          Collaborate with other architects and US-based clients to understand design requirements and project specifications.      Utilize AutoCAD software to produce detailed site plans.      Well-versed with imperial unit measurement methods      Responsible for creating models, developing construction drawings, and working on documentation drawings.      Other common tasks include updating plans and elevations and creating site plans.      Responsible for developing schematic design and design development sets and assisting with working drawings.      Additionally, future tasks will include tasks related to 3D modeling, rendering, and creating layouts, preparing permit sets, as-built, and demolition drawings, researching concepts, and developing concepts and proposal drawings are common with placements.                Qualifications:          Minimum Bachelor of Architecture, B.Tech/B.E. in Civil or a related field.      A professional Engineer (PE) license is preferred not mandatory.      3-5 years experience as a Civil Engineering Designer with a focus on civil drawings.      Proficient in AutoCAD, Civil 3D, and other relevant design software.      Strong portfolio showcasing diverse civil design projects.      Excellent understanding of construction methods, materials, and detailing.      Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.      Effective communication skills to interact with clients, architects, and project teams.      Knowledge of building codes and regulations.      Strong understanding of Imperial units and their application in engineering.      Excellent communication and teamwork skills.                Benefits:          Competitive salary with performance-based bonuses.      Health Insurance benefits.      Opportunities for professional growth and advancement.      Friendly and collaborative work environment.                Desired Attributes:          Were on the hunt for driven individuals with a fervent passion and a readiness to go above and beyond. We value those eager to learn, grow, and contribute significantly to the expansion of ATCs Design division.      Seeking dynamic go-getters with a proactive mindset.      This isnt your typical 9 to 5 role. We envision you as our future leader within the next five years.

column2: We are looking to hire a talented B.Tech / M Tech with specialization in Structural Engineering. In this role, you will be required to oversee the completion of Construction Projects and ensure structures are durable and safe. Experience in Rice Mill Setup will be preferred. Candidate who can collaborate with Contractors and monitor on-site construction is required.            To fit in this role, the candidate should possess strong Project Management and Analytical skills. A top-notch Structural Engineer who possess detailed knowledge of engineering and design principles and be able to find strong solutions to technical problems.          As a structural engineer, you will play a key role in the entire construction process, from initial design to final implementation.      Your expertise and attention to detail will be instrumental in delivering high-quality and structurally sound setup. Join our team and contribute to the success of our construction projects.                Requirement & Skills            Location : Ghaziabad, Tronica City      Reporting to : Managing Director & CEO      Designation : Structural Engineer      Function/Dept. : Design and Project      Work Exp. : 8-10 Years      CTC : As per industry standards      Qualification : Min Bachelors Degree (BTech Structural Engg) and MTech (Structural Eng.) is Desirable. Creating CAD files and Preparing BOM      Maintaining Revisions and Drawings of Files      Creating PFD and Installation drawings for rice mills, grain milling in ethanol etc.      Live and Dead load analysis      Maintaining Drawing files and revisions. With Planned vs actual      Maintaining installation and Fitting Drawings      AutoCad latest version , and Design of Civil and Mechanical structure and foundation drawings with calculations of load bearing capacity . column2: As a Structural Engineer, you will play a critical role in the design, analysis, and evaluation of various structures to ensure their safety, functionality, and compliance with relevant codes and regulations     Your expertise will be instrumental in developing innovative solutions for construction projects and providing technical support throughout the project lifecycle     You will collaborate with architects, construction teams, and other stakeholders to deliver high-quality structural designs and solutions     Key Responsibilities:Design and analyze structures, such as buildings, bridges, dams, and other infrastructure, using engineering principles and software tools     Develop detailed structural drawings, plans, and specifications, adhering to project requirements and building codes     Conduct site investigations and assess existing structures to evaluate their condition and identify potential issues     Perform structural calculations and simulations to ensure the integrity and stability of designs under different loading conditions     Collaborate with architects and other engineering disciplines to integrate structural designs with overall project requirements     Review and approve structural drawings and plans prepared by drafters and junior engineers     Provide technical support during construction, including responding to site queries and conducting site inspections     Address design changes and modifications during the construction phase, ensuring they comply with structural requirements     Utilize computer-aided design (CAD) and structural analysis software to streamline the design process and enhance efficiency     Stay updated with advancements in structural engineering technology, codes, and industry best practices     Qualifications and Requirements:Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering with a focus on Structural Engineering     A Master's degree is a plus     Proven experience as a Structural Engineer or in a similar role, with a track record of successful structural design projects     In-depth knowledge of structural engineering principles, building codes, and design standards     Proficiency in structural design and analysis software (eg, ETABS, SAP2000, STAADPro)     Strong understanding of materials properties and their behavior under different loading conditions     Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills to address complex structural challenges     Detail-oriented with the ability to create accurate and precise engineering drawings and specifications     Effective communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with multidisciplinary teams and stakeholders     Familiarity with construction practices and project management concepts     Professional engineering license or relevant certifications are advantageous

column2: As a Structural Design Engineer specializing in precast concrete, your role will involve designing, analyzing, and overseeing the construction of precast concrete structures. You will work closely with architects, drafters, and other engineering professionals to ensure the successful completion of projects.  Role & responsibilities  Your responsibilities will include: 1.  Structural Design:  Develop and analyze structural designs for precast concrete components and systems.?  Ensure designs comply with relevant building codes, standards, and regulations.  Use engineering software and tools to model and analyze structures for strength, stability, and safety. 2.  Precast Concrete Expertise:  Specialize in the design and detailing of precast concrete elements such as beams, columns, walls, and slabs.  Optimize designs for manufacturing efficiency and cost-effectiveness in precast production. 3.  Collaboration:  Work collaboratively with architects, drafters, and other engineering disciplines to integrate precast elements into overall building designs.  Communicate effectively with project teams to ensure design intent is maintained throughout construction. 4.  Quality Control:  Implement and oversee quality control processes for precast elements during manufacturing and construction phases.  Conduct inspections and evaluations to ensure compliance with design specifications. 5.  Project Management:  Assist in project management tasks and coordinating with construction teams.  Provide technical support and guidance during the construction phase. 6.  Innovation and Continuous Improvement:  Stay abreast of industry trends, new materials, and construction technologies related to precast concrete.  Propose and implement innovative solutions to enhance design efficiency and construction processes. 7.  Documentation:  Prepare detailed design drawings, specifications, and reports.  Maintain accurate and organized project documentation. 8.  Client Interaction:  Engage with clients to understand project requirements and address any design-related concerns.  Provide technical expertise and guidance in client meetings. Preferred candidate profile      Bachelor's or Master's degree in Civil or Structural Engineering.  Strong experience in structural design, particularly in precast concrete.  Proficiency in relevant engineering software (e.g., AutoCAD, tekla, etabs, safe). Perks and benefits

column2: Job Purpose: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Project Engineer specializing in Civil Structures to join our dynamic team. As a Project Engineer, you will play a crucial role in the successful design and execution of civil infrastructure projects. This is an excellent opportunity for an individual with 4 to 5 years of experience in design for the Highrise building and a basic knowledge of Drafting- BIM for the same.  Responsibilities: Collaborate with the project team to develop and implement innovative design solutions for civil structures, ensuring compliance with industry standards, codes,      and regulations. Conduct comprehensive research and analysis to support the design process,      including site investigations, feasibility studies, and structural assessments. Prepare detailed engineering designs, drawings, and specifications using various software.  Review and evaluate technical drawings and documentation to identify potential design issues and propose appropriate modifications or improvements. Coordinate with architects, contractors, and other stakeholders to ensure seamless integration of structural designs into overall project plans. Provide technical expertise and guidance throughout the construction phase,      responding to design-related queries and resolving construction issues. Perform structural calculations and simulations to assess the integrity,      stability, and safety of proposed designs. Conduct site visits and inspections to monitor construction progress, verify compliance with design specifications, and address any deviations or challenges. Prepare comprehensive project reports, including design analysis, progress updates, and recommendations for optimizing project efficiency and quality. Stay updated with emerging trends, advancements, and best practices in civil engineering, particularly in the field of structural design. Requirements: A master's degree in civil engineering will be preferable.  4 to 5 years of experience in civil engineering with a focus on structural design for a      Highrise building.  Strong knowledge and understanding of civil engineering principles, codes,      standards, and regulations. Proficiency in computer-aided design Software, such as ETABS, SAFE, REVIT, AutoCAD,      and Building Information Modelling (BIM) tools.  Demonstrated experience in drafting and preparing detailed engineering drawings and specifications. Ability to perform structural calculations and simulations using industry-standard software. Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think creatively to develop innovative solutions. Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with multidisciplinary teams and stakeholders. Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work within specified deadlines. Familiarity with construction processes and the ability to address on-site challenges effectively. Join our team and contribute your expertise to shape the future of civil infrastructure. Apply now and be a part of our exciting projects.

column2: Roles and Responsibilities  We are seeking a skilled Structural Engineer with 2-7 years of experience to join our dynamic team in the oil and gas industry. As a Structural Engineer, you will play a crucial role in the design, analysis, and assessment of various structures within oil and gas facilities, ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations.    Perform structural analysis and design for onshore and offshore oil and gas facilities, including platforms, modules, pipelines, and support structures. Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to develop cost-effective and innovative structural solutions that meet project requirements and specifications. Conduct feasibility studies and site investigations to assess structural integrity, stability, and performance under various loading conditions. Utilize engineering software and tools to model structures, analyze data, and optimize designs for strength, durability, and safety. Prepare detailed engineering drawings, reports, and technical documentation in accordance with project guidelines and client requirements. Participate in design reviews, risk assessments, and HAZOP studies to identify and mitigate potential structural hazards and challenges. Provide technical support during construction, commissioning, and operation phases, addressing any structural issues or deviations from design specifications. Stay updated on industry developments, codes, and standards related to structural engineering in the oil and gas sector, incorporating best practices into project designs Job Benefits & Perks

column2: Global Organisation                                 Collaborative working environment                                 Hybrid working arrangement                                 18 days annual leave                             Employee Mediclaim Insurance and Term Life Insurance                             The opportunity to work for an organisation that has a strong sense of purpose, is values driven and helps colleagues to develop professionally and personally through our range of people development programmes                                                        The role                                     Lloyds Register Marine and Offshore provide a wide range of services to industry world-wide involving design verification, independent analysis and consultancy activities in various disciplines, including those of naval architecture, structures, pipelines, geotechnics, safety and mechanical engineering                     We are looking to recruit a Senior Structural Specialist to join our UK Fixed Structures Team     This team has substantial expertise in providing independent assurance for design and operational aspects of offshore and onshore structures for a range of industries including the renewable and oil and gas sectors                                Key Responsibilities                                   Reporting to the Fixed Structures Team Leader, the key responsibilities are as follows:                                     Undertake design appraisal activities with respect to offshore structures including fixed, near shore and floating offshore concrete structures to ensure compliance with specified rules, codes, Regulations, standards and specifications within agreed parameters including budget and contractual requirements;                                 Undertake design appraisal activities with respect to industrial, nuclear and cryogenic concrete structures to ensure compliance with specified rules, codes, Regulations, standards and specifications within agreed parameters including budget and contractual requirements;                                 To act as a point of reference both internally and externally, for issues relating to concrete design and concrete construction.                                 To develop technically other employees, as appropriate and share information to achieve effective knowledge transfer and application.                                 To represent Lloyds Register on technical committees for certification bodies, manage internal and external audits.                                 To contribute to the preparation of bids and tenders for concrete projects.                                       What you bring                                       Bachelors degree in Structural or Civil Engineering;                                 5 to 10 years of relevant experience in the design of concrete structures in an offshore environment with comprehensive experience in the design and analysis of offshore and onshore structures;                                 Strong theoretical and working knowledge of reinforced concrete and post-tensioned concrete design and construction.                                 Experience in analysis and design of concrete structures to international codes and standards (eg EN 1992, ISO 19903, AS3600, ACI 318 etc).                                 Experience in using and interpreting the output of appropriate engineering software such as STAAD.Pro, SACS, ABAQUS, ANSYS etc,                                 Effective communications in written and spoken English with the ability to prepare discuss and present deliverables to a client at a senior level.

column2: Our Energy business has been operating for over four decades and the pace of change has never been greater than it is now     These are critical times in how the world generates and uses Energy     Our Design and Engineering teams are key to the multi- disciplinary design and assurance services that we provide to our Clients in the Renewables, Conventional Generation, Oil Gas, Energy from Waste, Energy Storage and Petrochemical Markets        By working with the vibrant Energy and Consultancy Business, you will have the opportunity to work across the whole market including Renewables and Oil Gas.         A growing workload within the Offshore Wind business is providing exciting opportunities to work within large multi-disciplinary teams delivering complex, innovative solutions. In this role, you will work primarily with the Offshore Wind Team as part of a workshare program with the UK offices, leading the technical delivery of offshore projects.         We have been involved in nearly 60 offshore windfarm developments around the globe, have fully designed 19 offshore substation projects, over 300 offshore WTG foundations (both monopiles and jackets) for both fixed and floating substructure, and are involved in the daily structural integrity management of over 1000 WTG structures and have experience on 11 floating offshore wind projects.         Within the oil and gas division, our services are focused on upstream operations engineering ie maintain safe and efficient operations for operators, and offshore engineering encompassing fixed, floating, and subsea facilities     Having worked on 1,000 oil and gas installations around the world, we are now the operators go to company for difficult challenges in engineering, operations, life extension and ultimately decommissioning which is expected to be a growing market     Our structural Oil Gas team works on some of the most exciting and varied projects in onshore and offshore Oil and Gas sector, including front end design, consultancy studies, integrity management of topsides and subsea structures of fixed and floating assets, and decommissioning        In addition to the responsibilities listed herein, the employee may be required to perform other ad-hoc tasks as needed or directed by the supervisor or management     These tasks will be within the reasonable scope of the employees skills, capabilities, and role within the organization     The intent of this provision is to allow for flexibility and adaptability in meeting the dynamic needs of the organization, ensuring that operational requirements can be met efficiently     All such tasks will be assigned considering the employees current workload and with respect to their professional development                Skills             An engineering degree, honors or equivalent in civil, mechanical, structural naval architecture or similar.      Experience of leading teams of engineers to deliver complete packages of work, as well as being the main point of contact for technical          Demonstrable experience in producing detailed designs and good understanding of local and global analytical processes of offshore structures.         Experience of working with local and geographically disparate teams and resources. Able to motivate self and teams, deal with conflict and create a strong delivery culture.         Proven success in structural projects against external and internal time, cost, and quality objectives. Experience in participating in appropriate project governance and project management reporting.         Offshore structural analysis experience of jackets, floating and subsea systems particularly using SACS / SESAM software.         Experience in the application of offshore structural standards including ISO, DNVGL, IEC NORSOK.         Experience in the application of spectral and deterministic fatigue methodologies.     Technical understanding of environmental wave loading and/or vessel motions.     Experience of applying appropriate quality assurance and reporting.         Experience of partaking in elements of bids and engaging directly with clients.         Ability to report, interpret and communicate the engineering implications of complex analysis results to colleagues and clients, including the implications of problems encountered in the delivery of work.         Excellent report writing skills and experience in the delivery of technical presentations to external clients.         Understanding of structural engineering first principals, this is a technical role.         Management, assessment and analysis of designs, modifications, and anomalies.         Linear and non-linear FEA experience in ABAQUS and USFOS and other comparable software packages is preferred.         Background in offshore structural integrity service delivery is advantageous.     Chartered status with a recognized engineering institution is considered advantageous.         Some work outside normal office hours may be necessary. Travel to and from client sites and / or temporary secondment to client s offices may also be required with opportunities for international travel           Competencies           You ll have excellent written and verbal communication, listening, stakeholder management and influencing skills.     You ll be able to manage client relationships, engage constructively with multiple stakeholders and lead technical delivery teams.         You will have good experience in a Structural Analysis and Design role, with specific experience in undertaking primary steel analysis of offshore substructures.         You will have experience of delivering full packages of design work.         You will be able to appreciate complex practical, technical, and commercial issues and to work constructively with a broad range of stakeholders; leading project teams that are either local to you or distributed across multiple sites. This will          nclude everything from hand calculations, written reports to linear and non-linear analysis work.         You ll enjoy turning your hand to new challenges and will be keen to learn, whilst also wanting to support others within our diverse teams.         You ll be self-motivated, positive, enthusiastic, reliable, consistent and have a mature approach to work appropriate to delivering growth in the face of challenging market conditions           Knowledge/Skills and Experience:               2-8 years for Engineer role and 8+ years for Senior Engineer role - basic and detail engineering experience in Upstream Oil Gas, Refinery, Petrochemical industry. Candidates having experience in Engineering office of Reputed Consulting Engineering. Companies preferably in the field of Refinery, Petrochemicals, Chemicals, Fertilizers, Oil Gas will be preferred.         Masters/Bachelor of Engineering OR Bachelor of Technology in Civil Engineering         Employee is responsible for adhering to all health and safety procedures, reporting hazards or incidents promptly, and actively participating in maintaining a safe workplace.         Ensure mandatory safety training are completed

column2: Job   Description   Design   Engineer   -   Structural Reports   to:   Lead   Engineer   -   Structural Job   Description: Structural engineers are accountable for the creation of drawings, specifications and calculations while also ensuring that the work meets relevant codes, accepted engineering practices, and applicable standards. They are also in charge of executing independent work that entails assessing, choosing, applying and modifying structural engineering methods, processes and Jord standards. Duties   and   Responsibilities: ??Execute designs of plant equipment for efficient structural design concepts. ??Read and understand structural codes, construction specifications, drawings and review design plans. ??Perform structural design and analytical calculation using governing codes and standards, ??Perform structural design and analysis calculations using governing codes and standards, engineering  formulas, skills, and experience. ??Provide drawing for designs and produce sketches to incorporate in drawings by Designers/Drafters ??Coordinate work with other disciplines such as mechanical, electrical and other inter disciplinary ??Use computer-assisted engineering and design software to prepare engineering design documents ??Ensure all pertinent input data is available for team members to complete the necessary tasks. ??Create and maintain company and reference standards for structural designs and procedures. ??Monitor quality of documentation issued from engineering and strive for zero errors. ??Resolve structural engineering issues with shop /client through lead design engineers. ??Research design options and document findings for project lead engineer ??Perform special tasks/design calculations as assigned. ??Report any critical risks to the Lead Design / Engineering Manager Skills   and   Experience: ??Graduate preferably Post Graduate qualification in Structural / Civil Engineering ??Over 10-15 years of experience with advance knowledge in civil and/or structural engineering ??Strong analytical, problem solving and communication skills. ??Knowledge of civil/structural design standards (ACI, AISC, ASCE, EURO, BS, GBCODE) ??Working knowledge of design software, STAAD Pro ??Excellent attention to detail ??Must be able to work cross functionally with team members at all levels across multiple departments involved in different projects ??Ability to think creatively in order to optimize designs ??Able to discuss and resolve structural design changes

Analysis of Client Requirements: Carefully review and understand the detailed requirements  provided by the sales and marketing team or directly by the clients.  2. Coordination with Designers: Work closely with structural designers to convey client  requirements accurately and ensure that the proposed designs are feasible and optimized.  3. Technical Validation: Utilize design software  (like MBS or STAAD)  to validate the accuracy and  efficiency of PEB designs and calculations provided by designers.  4. Optimization of Proposals: Suggest modifications or alternatives to designs that can enhance  the project's cost-effectiveness without compromising quality or client specifications.  5. Quality Assurance: Ensure that all designs and proposals meet the high-quality standards  expected by clients and comply with relevant engineering codes and practices.  6. Client Communication: Assist in explaining the technical aspects of the proposal to clients,  highlighting the benefits and addressing any technical queries they may have.  7. Continuous Learning: Stay updated with the latest developments in design software,  structural engineering practices, and industry standards to continuously improve work  quality.  Key Result Areas (KRAs)  1. Accuracy and Efficiency: Ensuring PEB designs are accurate, meet all specifications, and are  optimized for cost and material usage.  2. Quality Assurance: Achieving a low error rate in designs and proposals before submission to  clients.  3. Client Satisfaction: Contributing to high client satisfaction through the provision of  technically sound and optimized solutions.  4. Continuous Improvement: Demonstrating continuous improvement in work processes,  software proficiency, and design optimization techniques.  5. Professional Development: Keeping abreast of the latest developments in structural  engineering software and practices.

column2: :  We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Structural Engineer to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for designing, analysing, and providing recommendations for structural components and systems for various construction projects. The Structural Engineer will work closely with architects, and other engineers to ensure that projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest standard of quality. Design, analyse and recommend structural components and systems for construction projects. Evaluate the feasibility of proposed designs and analyse their impact on the overall project. Collaborate with architects, builders, and other engineers to ensure that the design meets the project's needs and requirements. Conduct site visits to assess existing structures and determine the feasibility of proposed modifications or additions. Prepare detailed reports and technical drawings that outline the design, specifications, and materials needed for the project. Review and approve construction plans, specifications, and cost estimates. Provide technical guidance and support to construction teams during the construction phase of the project. Ensure that all designs and construction plans comply with local building codes and regulations.       Job Requirement         Bachelor's or Master's degree in Civil or Structural Engineering. Minimum of 5 years of experience in structural design and analysis. Strong knowledge of structural analysis software and techniques. Proficiency in AutoCAD and other relevant design software. CAD (Computer-Aided Design) software: This software is used to create 2D and 3D models of structures, including architectural and engineering drawings. FEA (Finite Element Analysis) software: This software is used to analyse and simulate complex structures under various loads and conditions, and to determine their strength and stability. BIM (Building Information Modelling) software: This software is used to create digital models of buildings and other structures, and to manage and analyse information about them throughout their lifecycle. Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with architects, builders, and other engineers. Excellent attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. If you are a highly skilled and experienced Structural Engineer with a passion for designing innovative and efficient structural systems, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Structural Analysis  - Conduct structural analysis and simulations to ensure the bridge's integrity and stability under various loads and conditions. Code Compliance - Ensure that bridge designs comply with relevant national and international standards and codes of practice. Technical Expertise : Demonstrate a deep understanding of civil engineering principles, structural analysis, and bridge design methodologies. Utilize software tools and perform complex calculations to assess structural integrity and stability. Budgeting  - Provide cost estimates and budget analysis for bridge design and construction projects. Collaboration : Collaborate with multi-disciplinary teams, including geotechnical engineers, transportation engineers, and environmental specialists, to integrate all aspects of bridge design and construction. Construction Support : Provide technical support during the construction phase of bridge projects. Address design-related queries, review shop drawings, and assist in resolving on-site engineering challenges . Safety Measures  - Implement safety measures and standards to protect workers and the public during construction and throughout the bridge's lifespan. Project Management  - Collaborate with project managers to create project plans, budgets  and timelines for bridge construction projects. Preferred candidate profile  -  1. More than six years of work experience in bridge design. 2. Should be well conversant with Indian codes and procedures for Bridge Designing. 3. Perks and benefits  - Best in the industry.

column2: Our Structural Design team is responsible for the design of project specific, offshore wind turbine towers and foundations, focusing on the primary (load carrying) structure.      The team handles not only the structural design, but also the drawings, production specifications, assesses any production deviations and is driving new technology developments in this field.      Design of offshore support structures is a multidisciplinary task in which we combine knowledge and understanding of the interplay between fields such as structural dynamics, hydrodynamics, geotechnics, (aeroelastic) loads analysis and production engineering. As such we are looking for people that have experience in (a selection of) these fields.     The team has a presence in Den Haag (NL), Hamburg (DE), Vejle (DK) and Bangalore (IN).     The current position is open for the Bangalore office. Occasional international travel may be involved for training and/or project meeting purposes.             Depending on your field(s) of expertise the job encompasses (part of) the following responsibilities:           Perform project specific tower structure design and optimization studies for commercial as well as R&D projects.         Point of contact within your project(s) regarding the tower design scope, from the sales phase through installation.         Detailed design and analysis of project specific tower structures, covering tower shells, flange connections, doorframe, and other details in accordance with eg, Eurocode/DNVGL standards.         Execution of detailed analytical and/or finite element analyses.         Regular alignment with design stakeholders, including sales, loads, tower design, project management, CAD design.         Delivery of documentation for certification of the support structure.         Support R&D projects to develop the next generation support structure design solutions.               What You Need To Make a Difference           A passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change.      ?       We are also looking for           You hold an MTech/ MSc/ PhD degree in aerospace, civil, mechanical engineering, or an equivalent field.         At least 3 years of proven, relevant, work experience is seen as an advantage.         It is considered beneficial when you have experience in the offshore (wind) industry, and you are familiar with relevant (offshore) design standards such as Eurocode, DNVGL, etc         Should be familiar with dynamic analysis of structure, fatigue analysis and fracture mechanics         You are skilled in finite element analysis, preferably using ANSYS APDL or Workbench.         It is paramount that you are proficient in English, both in reading and writing.         We are seeking a person with excellent communication and presentation skills.         You thrive in an international environment; our projects bring together various employee groups, nationalities, cultures, and authorities.         As a person you should be enthusiastic, decisive, self-starting, result-oriented, customer focused, resourceful, and creative.               In return of your commitment, we offer you            Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come.         A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy         Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality.         Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization.         Competitive Pension Scheme

Mandatory Requirements:         bachelors or masters Degree in Civil/Structural Engineering with minimum 8 years of relevant industrial experience. STAAD Pro, ETABS, Autodesk ROBOT or any other similar design package

column2: It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.         Siemens Gamesa has     a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a     green footprint - join us in      creating a better future for our planet.         We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.          In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues safety at the heart of our      organisation     .           How to contribute to our vision               Role Brief:       Plans, calculates, designs, develops, tests, and modifies experimental and/or operational mechanical concepts or subsystems.           In addition to the above you will be responsible for the following:           Develops mechanical components.     Tests mechanical components.     Identifies and selects components, materials, parts and semi-products appropriate for mechanical system design.     Creates mechanical models and tolerance analyses to simulate mechanical design concepts.     Calculates and creates final layout including documentation and specification for parts, assemblies, or finished products.     Maintains technical product files.     Analyzes existing development procedures and suggests improvements.     Implements or tests design solutions.     Upgrades the design of existing devices by adding mechanical elements.     Analyzes localization requirements and designs/adapts products and solutions accordingly.     Carrying out the structural assessments for various components and suggesting design changed based on results.           What you need to make a difference           A passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are also looking for          Qualifications and person specification          BE / B.Tech / ME /M.Tech in Mechanical Engineering.     Total Experience: 10 - 15 Years (min 3 years of relevant experience in Wind Industry is Preferable)     Analyze, Review and Understand structural design requirement for design of wind turbine nacelle components.     Create FEA model for calculation by model simplification, define different type of connections.     FEA calculation of structures with hands on experience in Ansys software.     Result interpretation and post processing of results     Knowledge about the structural design of large castings, welded structures and forged components.     Perform analytical calculations for welded/bolted constructions.     Experience in fatigue and buckling calculations.     Create documentation as per certification requirements.     Design changes and design optimization activities.     Constant research & improvement of the FEA calculations.     Hands on experience in 3D design software NX (Preferable: To transfer the 3D models to Ansys Environment).     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.     Experience on material selection.     Exposure to International standards on safety and mechanical design.     Exposure to certification requirements for WTG components or similar     Advanced level knowledge of Ansys Software.     Advanced level knowledge of Machine design.     Align simulation activities and pass criteria with the design teams for each wind turbine platform to secure proper design and integration.     Drive technical solutions and reviews with internal design team and multiple sub-suppliers and solution providers     Ensure time and quality in the deliveries to our development projects     Task coordination and priorities, as well as task execution of key tasks     Good at communicating within the team as well as with all the stake holders     Good command over English in written and spoken communication.     Highly proactive & self initiator     Good at decision making           In return of your commitment we offer you              Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come          A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy          Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality         Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organisation         Competitive pension scheme               Siemens Gamesa      offers a wide variety of benefits such as f     lexible working hours as well as home-office      possibility for many colleagues, e     mployer-funded pension, attractive remuneration package (fixed/variable) and local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more             Empowering our people          https: /  / www.siemensgamesa.com / sustainability / employees             How do you imagine the future?         https://youtu.be/12Sm678tjuY             Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions - the greatest challenge we face.         We believe diversity creates more opportunity for success. That s why we'recruit great minds from all walks of life: it doesn t matter the gender, age, ethnic background, sexual orientation, or disability.          Our main aim is to find people from around the globe who can contribute to world-changing technology.                   .

column2: Nauvata Engineering Pvt Ltd is looking for Structural Lead Engineer to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      As a Structural Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, analyzing, and evaluating structures to ensure their safety, stability, and durability      You'll work on a variety of projects, including buildings, bridges, dams, towers, and other infrastructure projects      Your expertise in structural engineering principles, codes, and analysis tools will contribute to the successful completion of projects from conception to construction        Responsibilities:        Structural Design: Design and analyze structural systems, components, and elements using engineering principles, codes, and software tools to ensure compliance with project requirements and safety standards      Engineering Calculations: Perform structural calculations and simulations to assess load capacities, stresses, deflections, and other structural behaviors, verifying design adequacy and performance      Technical Drawings: Prepare detailed structural drawings, plans, and specifications using CAD (Computer-Aided Design) software, ensuring accuracy and clarity for construction purposes      Material Selection: Select appropriate construction materials, such as concrete, steel, timber, and composite materials, based on project requirements, structural performance criteria, and environmental factors      Code Compliance: Ensure compliance with relevant building codes, regulations, and standards (eg, ACI, AISC, ASCE, IBC) governing structural design, construction, and safety      Structural Analysis: Conduct structural analysis using finite element analysis (FEA) software, computational modeling techniques, and hand calculations to evaluate structural behavior under various loading conditions and assess design alternatives      Seismic Design: Incorporate seismic design principles and techniques into structural designs to mitigate the effects of earthquakes and other seismic events, ensuring structural resilience and safety      Construction Support: Provide technical support to construction teams during the construction phase, reviewing shop drawings, responding to RFIs (Requests for Information), and addressing field issues to ensure compliance with design intent and specifications      Quality Assurance: Conduct quality assurance reviews of structural designs, calculations, and documentation to ensure accuracy, completeness, and compliance with project requirements and industry standards

column2: The Structural Designer is an employee responsible to issue the execution documentation for the scope of the Structural department of the Energy Business of John Cockerill, mainly steel structure, casing/ducting, stack, insulation works. He/She assures the delivery on time of General Arrangement, manufacturing, and erection drawings according to the milestones defined by the execution Project Teams. He/She is particularly responsible to deliver his/her work in conformity with internal quality standards as defined in the QMS (quality management system) of the Energy Business of John Cockerill.                     The Structural Designer is responsible for the delivery of the execution documentation of the projects for the scope of the Structural Department under the hierarchical responsibility of the Structural Manager and the functional responsibility of the Structural Engineer with the following objectives:                         Respect of the Design Process as defined in the QMS of the Business,                     Technical conformity of the execution documentation to internal standards and contractual requirements,                      Supply of a fast and reliable service to the execution teams in order to respect the document and equipment contractual delivery schedules of projects.                           Key Responsibilities                       The duties of the Structural Designer are amongst others:                         Study of Inputs and other requirements                     Check the completeness of the inputs received from the Technical Project Manager in order to proceed to his/her work and if not, the RFI document should be created and send it to the concern person of the project.                     Issue the execution documentation (mainly all types of drawings) in compliance with internal standards and contractual requirements,                     Issue the execution documentation in compliance with administrative standards,                     Issue the reports like Assembly Part list (BOM), Material list (BOQ) & bolt list etc                      Issue and update the standard technical documentation of the Structural Department,                     Keep his/her competencies updated with regards to the needs of the Energy Sector,                     Be proactive in the continuous improvement and REX processes.                             Education & Experience                              2 to 5 years of     relevant experience within an engineering context.                     ITI or Diploma of Civil or Mechanical Engineering                               Background, Skills, and Competencies                           The Structural Designer has a specialist profile       . Assist in the coordination and integration of various building systems (e.g., mechanical, electrical, plumbing) within the Tekla environment. Generate construction documentation, including plans, elevations, sections, and schedules, with a focus on accuracy and clarity.  Review and mark up drawings for errors, omissions, and quality assurance, and make necessary revisions to ensure compliance with project requirements. column2: Layout Design: Developing detailed and optimized layouts for various integrated circuits, ensuring they meet performance, power, and area specifications      This involves placing transistors, interconnects, and other components on the semiconductor substrate      Custom Layout: Designing custom layouts for specific circuits, which may include analog circuits, digital circuits, mixed-signal circuits, or radio-frequency (RF) circuits      Physical Verification: Conducting physical verification processes, such as design rule checking (DRC) and layout versus schematic (LVS) checks, to ensure that the layout adheres to fabrication rules and accurately reflects the intended schematic design      Technology Nodes: Working with advanced semiconductor manufacturing processes and technology nodes, which may involve sub-10nm processes, FinFET technology, or other cutting-edge techniques      CAD Tools: Proficiency in using Computer-Aided Design (CAD) tools and layout software for IC design, such as Cadence Virtuoso, Synopsys IC Compiler, or Mentor Graphics Calibre      Optimization: Optimizing layout designs for factors like power consumption, signal integrity, electromagnetic interference (EMI), and manufacturability

Designing of GIS buildings, Control Rooms, Switchyard civils, Transformer bunds and foundations.     Civils/Structure detailing, calculations, and material take-off.     Design Basis Reports based client specifications.     Perform studies, write reports, specifications, and other technical documentation. Coordinate the work internally as well as with the client.         Mandatory Requirements:         Masters / bachelors degree in Civil/Structural engineering with 5 to 12 years of relevant industrial experience.     Thorough knowledge in Civil engineering fundamentals and concepts for Transmission, distribution, and generation segments.     Understand engineering concepts and capable of interfacing with different departments.     Capability to produce good quality drawings, design calculations, technical reports and specifications.     Meet the requirements of international codes and standards.     Must have working knowledge in BIM environment.     Professional spirit and good organizational skills.     Lead and carry out consulting, research, and development study projects. Collaborate with architects, contractors, and other engineers to develop structural designs and finishing plans for high-rise residential buildings, with a focus on brickwork. 2. Conduct thorough inspections of construction sites to assess the progress, quality, and safety of brickwork installations. 3. Analyze structural calculations, specifications, and blueprints to ensure compliance with building codes, regulations, and project requirements. 4. Provide technical expertise and guidance to construction teams regarding the installation, reinforcement, and finishing of brick walls and structures. 5. Perform detailed calculations and simulations to determine the structural integrity and load-bearing capacity of brickwork components. 6. Oversee the selection and testing of construction materials, including bricks, mortar, and reinforcement materials, to ensure quality and durability. 7. Develop and implement efficient construction methods and techniques to optimize the speed, cost, and quality of brickwork installations. 8. Troubleshoot and resolve any structural or finishing issues that arise during the construction process, ensuring timely resolution to avoid delays or cost overruns. 9. Keep abreast of industry trends, best practices, and advancements in structural engineering and finishing technologies. 10. Mentor and train junior engineers and construction staff to enhance their skills and knowledge in structural engineering and finishing techniques. Qualifications: 1. Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering, or a related field. Master's degree preferred. 2. Exp 2-7 years of relevant experience in structural engineering and finishing, with a focus on high-rise residential buildings and brickwork. Proficiency in structural analysis software CAD      software (e.g., AutoCAD, Revit). Strong knowledge of building codes,      regulations, and industry standards related to structural design and      construction. Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and      decision-making skills. Effective communication skills, with the      ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical      stakeholders. column2: Job Purpose: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Project Engineer specializing in Civil Structures to join our dynamic team. Perform structural calculations and simulations to assess the integrity,      stability, and safety of proposed designs. Prepare comprehensive project reports, including design analysis, progress updates, and recommendations for optimizing project efficiency and quality. Stay updated with emerging trends, advancements, and best practices in civil engineering, particularly in the field of structural design. Requirements: A master's degree in civil engineering will be preferable.  4 to 5 years of experience in civil engineering with a focus on structural design for a      Highrise building.  Strong knowledge and understanding of civil engineering principles, codes,      standards, and regulations. Proficiency in computer-aided design Software, such as ETABS, SAFE, REVIT, AutoCAD,      and Building Information Modelling (BIM) tools.  Demonstrated experience in drafting and preparing detailed engineering drawings and specifications. Ability to perform structural calculations and simulations using industry-standard software. Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think creatively to develop innovative solutions. Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with multidisciplinary teams and stakeholders. Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work within specified deadlines. Familiarity with construction processes and the ability to address on-site challenges effectively. column1: Senior Civil Structural Engineer - Must have experience in wind energy
column2: Job Summary : Looking for a Senior Civil Structural Engineer with a minimum of 10+ years of experience in wind turbine foundation design and a comprehensive understanding of various engineering aspects related to wind farms. The ideal candidate will play a pivotal role in the planning, design, and execution of wind farm projects, ensuring the structural integrity and reliability of our installations. This position will also include responsibilities for the preparation of specifications and bill of materials for civil works.   Responsibilities :   1. Wind Turbine Foundation Design : ??- Lead and oversee the design of wind turbine foundations, ensuring they meet all structural and safety requirements. ??- Utilize industry standards and best practices for foundation design to optimize the performance and longevity of the wind turbines.   2. Structural Analysis : ??- Perform structural analysis and simulations to validate the designs for wind turbine foundations and other structures within the wind farm. ??- Address any structural challenges and recommend improvements or modifications as needed.   3. Site Assessment : ??- Collaborate with the project development team to assess potential wind farm sites, taking into account soil conditions and geological factors. ??- Contribute to site selection and layout decisions to maximize the efficiency of the wind farm.   4. Specifications and Bill of Materials : ??- Prepare detailed specifications for civil works, including materials, construction methods, and quality standards. ??- Create comprehensive bill of materials (BOM) for civil works to facilitate procurement and construction planning.   5. Regulatory Compliance : ??- Ensure that all engineering designs and plans comply with local, state, and federal regulations related to wind farm development. ??- Collaborate with permitting authorities to secure necessary approvals.   6. Project Management : ??- Participate in project management activities, including budgeting, scheduling, and resource allocation for wind farm projects. ??- Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure project milestones are achieved on time and within budget.   7. Quality Assurance : ??- Implement quality control measures to verify the integrity of structural designs and construction processes. ??- Conduct regular inspections and evaluations of construction work to maintain high-quality standards.   8. Collaboration : ??- Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams, including electrical engineers, environmental specialists, and project managers, to achieve project goals. ??- Act as a subject matter expert and provide guidance to junior engineers and team members.   Interested candidates may apply to alimpiya.gogoi@avaada.com

Roles Responsibilities : 1.Lead the design process for civil infrastructure components of wind energy projects, including site layout, foundation design, access roads, and drainage systems.        2.Utilize CAD software to create detailed engineering drawings and schematics for civil elements, ensuring accuracy and compliance with industry standards.      3.Stay updated on codes, regulations, and permitting requirements related to civil engineering design for wind energy projects and ensure compliance throughout the project lifecycle.      4.Identify potential risks associated with civil design elements and develop mitigation strategies to address them, ensuring the successful implementation of engineering solutions.      5.Collaborate with project managers, construction teams, and subcontractors to coordinate the implementation of civil design elements within project timelines and budget constraints.

column2: Our Energy business has been operating for over four decades and the pace of change has never been greater than it is now     These are critical times in how the world generates and uses Energy     Our Design and Engineering teams are key to the multi- disciplinary design and assurance services that we provide to our Clients in the Renewables, Conventional Generation, Oil Gas, Energy from Waste, Energy Storage and Petrochemical Markets        By working with the vibrant Energy and Consultancy Business, you will have the opportunity to work across the whole market including Renewables and Oil Gas.         A growing workload within the Offshore Wind business is providing exciting opportunities to work within large multi-disciplinary teams delivering complex, innovative solutions. In this role, you will work primarily with the Offshore Wind Team as part of a workshare program with the UK offices, leading the technical delivery of offshore projects.         We have been involved in nearly 60 offshore windfarm developments around the globe, have fully designed 19 offshore substation projects, over 300 offshore WTG foundations (both monopiles and jackets) for both fixed and floating substructure, and are involved in the daily structural integrity management of over 1000 WTG structures and have experience on 11 floating offshore wind projects.         Within the oil and gas division, our services are focused on upstream operations engineering ie maintain safe and efficient operations for operators, and offshore engineering encompassing fixed, floating, and subsea facilities     Having worked on 1,000 oil and gas installations around the world, we are now the operators go to company for difficult challenges in engineering, operations, life extension and ultimately decommissioning which is expected to be a growing market     Our structural Oil Gas team works on some of the most exciting and varied projects in onshore and offshore Oil and Gas sector, including front end design, consultancy studies, integrity management of topsides and subsea structures of fixed and floating assets, and decommissioning        In addition to the responsibilities listed herein, the employee may be required to perform other ad-hoc tasks as needed or directed by the supervisor or management     These tasks will be within the reasonable scope of the employees skills, capabilities, and role within the organization     The intent of this provision is to allow for flexibility and adaptability in meeting the dynamic needs of the organization, ensuring that operational requirements can be met efficiently     All such tasks will be assigned considering the employees current workload and with respect to their professional development                Skills             An engineering degree, honors or equivalent in civil, mechanical, structural naval architecture or similar.      Experience of leading teams of engineers to deliver complete packages of work, as well as being the main point of contact for technical          Demonstrable experience in producing detailed designs and good understanding of local and global analytical processes of offshore structures.         Experience of working with local and geographically disparate teams and resources. Able to motivate self and teams, deal with conflict and create a strong delivery culture.         Proven success in structural projects against external and internal time, cost, and quality objectives. Experience in participating in appropriate project governance and project management reporting.         Offshore structural analysis experience of jackets, floating and subsea systems particularly using SACS / SESAM software.         Experience in the application of offshore structural standards including ISO, DNVGL, IEC NORSOK.         Experience in the application of spectral and deterministic fatigue methodologies.     Technical understanding of environmental wave loading and/or vessel motions.     Experience of applying appropriate quality assurance and reporting.         Experience of partaking in elements of bids and engaging directly with clients.         Ability to report, interpret and communicate the engineering implications of complex analysis results to colleagues and clients, including the implications of problems encountered in the delivery of work.         Excellent report writing skills and experience in the delivery of technical presentations to external clients.         Understanding of structural engineering first principals, this is a technical role.         Management, assessment and analysis of designs, modifications, and anomalies.         Linear and non-linear FEA experience in ABAQUS and USFOS and other comparable software packages is preferred.         Background in offshore structural integrity service delivery is advantageous.     Chartered status with a recognized engineering institution is considered advantageous.         Some work outside normal office hours may be necessary. Travel to and from client sites and / or temporary secondment to client s offices may also be required with opportunities for international travel           Competencies           You ll have excellent written and verbal communication, listening, stakeholder management and influencing skills.     You ll be able to manage client relationships, engage constructively with multiple stakeholders and lead technical delivery teams.         You will have good experience in a Structural Analysis and Design role, with specific experience in undertaking primary steel analysis of offshore substructures.         You will have experience of delivering full packages of design work.         You will be able to appreciate complex practical, technical, and commercial issues and to work constructively with a broad range of stakeholders; leading project teams that are either local to you or distributed across multiple sites. This will          nclude everything from hand calculations, written reports to linear and non-linear analysis work.         You ll enjoy turning your hand to new challenges and will be keen to learn, whilst also wanting to support others within our diverse teams.         You ll be self-motivated, positive, enthusiastic, reliable, consistent and have a mature approach to work appropriate to delivering growth in the face of challenging market conditions           Knowledge/Skills and Experience:               2-8 years for Engineer role and 8+ years for Senior Engineer role - basic and detail engineering experience in Upstream Oil Gas, Refinery, Petrochemical industry. Candidates having experience in Engineering office of Reputed Consulting Engineering. Companies preferably in the field of Refinery, Petrochemicals, Chemicals, Fertilizers, Oil Gas will be preferred.         Masters/Bachelor of Engineering OR Bachelor of Technology in Civil Engineering         Employee is responsible for adhering to all health and safety procedures, reporting hazards or incidents promptly, and actively participating in maintaining a safe workplace.         Ensure mandatory safety training are completed

column2: 1) Hands-on and in-depth knowledge of Structural designs for Industrial projects      2) Analys, design, detail engineering and costing of Plant / Non-plant buildings (both RCC and structural steel), pipe racks, foundations, liquid retaining structures, equipment foundations for fabricated and rotating equipment, roads / storm water drains , paving, roads , dikes, ring wall & tank foundations, etc.     3) Must be able to perform squad checks on drawing received from other disciplines. Requires interaction with own and other discipline to complete design tasks as well as with clients.      4) Assisting with technical clarification, discussions, directions, instructions, supervision & trouble shooting (if required) to the design/execution team/s at site as per the approved design & drawings.     5) Must be capable of reading Piping, Mechanical and Electrical GA drawings.       Typical work activities:    - Work activities vary depending on the type of employers and nature of the project but typically involve:      a) Finalization of Civil & structural drawings      b) Acting as the main technical adviser on a construction site for subcontractors, crafts people and operatives.      c) Setting out, leveling and surveying the site.      d) Checking plans, drawings and quantities for accuracy of calculations.      e) Managing, monitoring and interpreting the contract design documents supplied by the client/architect.      f) Liaising with any consultants, subcontractors, supervisors, planners, quantity surveyors and the general workforce involved in the project.      g) Preparing reports as required.     h) Resolving any unexpected technical difficulties and other problems that may arise.       Desired profile of the candidate         8+ years of experience in industrial structural projects, In-depth knowledge in structural design, engineering & execution, preparing, checking & approval of drawings, calculations, site coordination, contractors selection, Vendor coordination, Quality Inspection, Quantity & Bills certification      Certified to approve Structural Drawings      Experience in pharmaceutical/ Biotech/ Food & Beverage projects preferred      Exposure and understanding of Civil Engineering will be an added advantage.         UG / PG Qualification         ME (Structural) with 8+ Years of experience        OR        BE (Civil) with 10+ Years of experience Mandatory: Certified to Approve Structural Drawings          Minimum Experience         8+ years in Industrial Structural Projects (Design, Engineering & Execution), site coordination & management (Preferably in Pharma / Biotech projects)

column2: Job   Description   Design   Engineer   -   Structural Reports   to:   Lead   Engineer   -   Structural Job   Description: Structural engineers are accountable for the creation of drawings, specifications and calculations while also ensuring that the work meets relevant codes, accepted engineering practices, and applicable standards. They are also in charge of executing independent work that entails assessing, choosing, applying and modifying structural engineering methods, processes and Jord standards. Duties   and   Responsibilities: ??Execute designs of plant equipment for efficient structural design concepts. ??Read and understand structural codes, construction specifications, drawings and review design plans. ??Perform structural design and analytical calculation using governing codes and standards, ??Perform structural design and analysis calculations using governing codes and standards, engineering  formulas, skills, and experience. ??Provide drawing for designs and produce sketches to incorporate in drawings by Designers/Drafters ??Coordinate work with other disciplines such as mechanical, electrical and other inter disciplinary ??Use computer-assisted engineering and design software to prepare engineering design documents ??Ensure all pertinent input data is available for team members to complete the necessary tasks. ??Create and maintain company and reference standards for structural designs and procedures. ??Monitor quality of documentation issued from engineering and strive for zero errors. ??Resolve structural engineering issues with shop /client through lead design engineers. ??Research design options and document findings for project lead engineer ??Perform special tasks/design calculations as assigned. ??Report any critical risks to the Lead Design / Engineering Manager Skills   and   Experience: ??Graduate preferably Post Graduate qualification in Structural / Civil Engineering ??Over 10-15 years of experience with advance knowledge in civil and/or structural engineering ??Strong analytical, problem solving and communication skills. ??Knowledge of civil/structural design standards (ACI, AISC, ASCE, EURO, BS, GBCODE) ??Working knowledge of design software, STAAD Pro ??Excellent attention to detail ??Must be able to work cross functionally with team members at all levels across multiple departments involved in different projects ??Ability to think creatively in order to optimize designs ??Able to discuss and resolve structural design changes

column2: Role & responsibilities   Job Responsibilities:  Lead, motivate and support the structural and civil design team.  Be responsible for technical and professional development of the team.  Be responsible for work delivered by the team.  Create, develop and support and seek tools and techniques that enable efficient use of resources and help and improve efficiency of delivery of work by setting up and reviewing systems from time to time.  Develop, review and update standards of practices, specifications, innovative ways of construction techniques or methodologies in consultation with the Project Manager, Senior Management and other stakeholders.  To ensure projects are designed within the statutory, regulatory and financial outputs of the Business Plan while complying with procurement processes at all times.  Ensure best in class Health and Safety performance both internally and externally by all civil and structural engineers and designers working on projects.  Ensure designing aesthetically pleasing buildings and structures that are safe and capable of withstanding the elements to which they will be exposed.  Engineering calculations about loads, stresses measurements etc. have to be consistent as per project requirements and best industry practices where applicable.  Ensure the project runs smoothly and the structural design, drawings and any other deliverable related to Structural work is completed within budget and on schedule as agreed or revised from time to time.  Ensure accuracy of work for government submission and for construction.  Obtaining planning and/or building regulations approval and providing technical advice if required.  Preparing various reports, designs, drawings and/or make modifications of drawings and plans.  Ensuring team coordinates with other departments for smooth project completion. Where needed, support and facilitate inter-disciplinary coordination for smooth completion of work and establish better coordination systems.  Be responsible for the quality of deliverables produced by the team. Develop systems that enable improved quality of work.  Encourage and inculcate leadership behaviour across the team. Technical Skill Set Required:  Logical analysis of problems and ability to tackle a variety of structures.  Must be computer literate and technology competent with a functional familiarity with BIM tools like Revit, Bentley tools and other industry prevalent tools.  Good familiarity with common tools like MS Office suite of tools. Personal/Behavioural Skill Set Required:  Good communication skills  Pleasant personality and approachable/ amicable.  Team player, Practical & Creative, Problem Solving  Able to accept responsibility and work without supervision

column2: Responsibilities: Structural Design and Analysis: Perform structural analysis and design of building systems, bridges, and other infrastructure projects using engineering software and tools. Design structural elements such as beams, columns, slabs, and foundations to meet project requirements and safety standards. Evaluate existing structures and recommend design modifications or retrofit solutions as needed. Construction Documentation: Prepare construction drawings, specifications, and calculations in accordance with applicable codes and regulations. Coordinate with architects, mechanical engineers, and other professionals to integrate structural elements into overall building designs. Review and approve shop drawings and construction documents prepared by contractors and subcontractors. Project Management: Manage multiple projects simultaneously, including planning, scheduling, and budgeting tasks. Coordinate with project managers, contractors, and clients to ensure project milestones are met on time and within budget. Monitor construction progress, address technical issues, and provide solutions to challenges encountered during construction. Quality Assurance and Compliance: Conduct structural inspections and assessments to ensure compliance with building codes, zoning regulations, and industry standards. Review and analyze test results, material specifications, and construction methods to verify structural integrity and safety. Provide guidance and support to construction teams to ensure proper implementation of structural designs and specifications. Risk Management and Mitigation: Identify potential risks and hazards related to structural design and construction activities and develop mitigation strategies. Perform structural risk assessments and recommend measures to enhance resilience and durability of structures. Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in structural engineering to mitigate risks and optimize project outcomes. Structural Design, Structural Engineer, Structural Analysis, Steel, Fabrication.
