column2: :  We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Structural Engineer to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for designing, analysing, and providing recommendations for structural components and systems for various construction projects. The Structural Engineer will work closely with architects, and other engineers to ensure that projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest standard of quality. Design, analyse and recommend structural components and systems for construction projects. Evaluate the feasibility of proposed designs and analyse their impact on the overall project. Collaborate with architects, builders, and other engineers to ensure that the design meets the project's needs and requirements. Conduct site visits to assess existing structures and determine the feasibility of proposed modifications or additions. Prepare detailed reports and technical drawings that outline the design, specifications, and materials needed for the project. Review and approve construction plans, specifications, and cost estimates. Provide technical guidance and support to construction teams during the construction phase of the project. Ensure that all designs and construction plans comply with local building codes and regulations.       Job Requirement         Bachelor's or Master's degree in Civil or Structural Engineering. Minimum of 5 years of experience in structural design and analysis. Strong knowledge of structural analysis software and techniques. Proficiency in AutoCAD and other relevant design software. CAD (Computer-Aided Design) software: This software is used to create 2D and 3D models of structures, including architectural and engineering drawings. FEA (Finite Element Analysis) software: This software is used to analyse and simulate complex structures under various loads and conditions, and to determine their strength and stability. BIM (Building Information Modelling) software: This software is used to create digital models of buildings and other structures, and to manage and analyse information about them throughout their lifecycle. Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with architects, builders, and other engineers. Excellent attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. If you are a highly skilled and experienced Structural Engineer with a passion for designing innovative and efficient structural systems, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.
column11: Construction, Software design, Usage, Architecture, AutoCAD, CAD, Bim, Finite element analysis, Management, Structural analysis

column2: Roles and Responsibilities  We are seeking a skilled Structural Engineer with 2-7 years of experience to join our dynamic team in the oil and gas industry. As a Structural Engineer, you will play a crucial role in the design, analysis, and assessment of various structures within oil and gas facilities, ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations.    Perform structural analysis and design for onshore and offshore oil and gas facilities, including platforms, modules, pipelines, and support structures. Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to develop cost-effective and innovative structural solutions that meet project requirements and specifications. Conduct feasibility studies and site investigations to assess structural integrity, stability, and performance under various loading conditions. Utilize engineering software and tools to model structures, analyze data, and optimize designs for strength, durability, and safety. Prepare detailed engineering drawings, reports, and technical documentation in accordance with project guidelines and client requirements. Participate in design reviews, risk assessments, and HAZOP studies to identify and mitigate potential structural hazards and challenges. Provide technical support during construction, commissioning, and operation phases, addressing any structural issues or deviations from design specifications. Stay updated on industry developments, codes, and standards related to structural engineering in the oil and gas sector, incorporating best practices into project designs Job Benefits & Perks
column11: Structural Engineering, Project Management, Project Planning

column2: As a Structural Engineer, you will play a critical role in the design, analysis, and evaluation of various structures to ensure their safety, functionality, and compliance with relevant codes and regulations     Your expertise will be instrumental in developing innovative solutions for construction projects and providing technical support throughout the project lifecycle     You will collaborate with architects, construction teams, and other stakeholders to deliver high-quality structural designs and solutions       Key Responsibilities:       Design and analyze structures, such as buildings, bridges, dams, and other infrastructure, using engineering principles and software tools     Develop detailed structural drawings, plans, and specifications, adhering to project requirements and building codes     Conduct site investigations and assess existing structures to evaluate their condition and identify potential issues     Perform structural calculations and simulations to ensure the integrity and stability of designs under different loading conditions     Collaborate with architects and other engineering disciplines to integrate structural designs with overall project requirements     Review and approve structural drawings and plans prepared by drafters and junior engineers     Provide technical support during construction, including responding to site queries and conducting site inspections     Address design changes and modifications during the construction phase, ensuring they comply with structural requirements     Utilize computer-aided design (CAD) and structural analysis software to streamline the design process and enhance efficiency     Stay updated with advancements in structural engineering technology, codes, and industry best practices       Qualifications and Requirements:       Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering with a focus on Structural Engineering     A Master's degree is a plus     Proven experience as a Structural Engineer or in a similar role, with a track record of successful structural design projects     In-depth knowledge of structural engineering principles, building codes, and design standards     Proficiency in structural design and analysis software (eg, ETABS, SAP2000, STAAD Pro)     Strong understanding of materials properties and their behavior under different loading conditions     Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills to address complex structural challenges     Detail-oriented with the ability to create accurate and precise engineering drawings and specifications     Effective communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with multidisciplinary teams and stakeholders     Familiarity with construction practices and project management concepts     Professional engineering license or relevant certifications are advantageous
column11: Structural design, Construction, Project management, Analytical, CAD, Staad Pro, Structural engineering, Technical support, Civil engineering, Structural analysis

Tools:       o Exposure to any design software/tool like STAAD Pro, Risa 3D, SAFE, ETABs, etc.     o AutoCAD     o Knowledge of Navisworks will be added advantage     o Knowledge of REVIT (Structural) or AutoCAD Plant 3D will be an added advantage.     o Microsoft Office Tools - MS Word, MS Excel, MS Power Point, Outlook, OneNot       Qualifications         Bachelors degree in Civil Engineering from a recognized institution. column2: Holtec Asia is currently seeking to immediately add mechanical/structural analysts to its Structural/Dynamic Group for its technology centre, Holtec Asia in India. Both entry level and experienced candidates are being sought.  Typical types of analyses include :-  Static and dynamic finite element modelling and analysis using ANSYS.  Modelling and analysis of structural impacts and target response using LS-DYNA  Simulation of the responses of freestanding structures in air or submerged in water.  Static and dynamic analysis of large reinforce concrete structures.  Soil-structure analysis with freestanding structures  The analyst would be called upon to analyse metallic weldments, reinforced concrete and soil-subgrade supported structures.  The applicant must have excellent credentials in solid mechanics with excellent written and verbal communication. He/she can work independently with less guidance. Also, can prepare detailed report of analysis in word format

column2: Nauvata Engineering Pvt Ltd is looking for Structural Lead Engineer to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      As a Structural Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, analyzing, and evaluating structures to ensure their safety, stability, and durability      You'll work on a variety of projects, including buildings, bridges, dams, towers, and other infrastructure projects      Your expertise in structural engineering principles, codes, and analysis tools will contribute to the successful completion of projects from conception to construction        Responsibilities:        Structural Design: Design and analyze structural systems, components, and elements using engineering principles, codes, and software tools to ensure compliance with project requirements and safety standards      Engineering Calculations: Perform structural calculations and simulations to assess load capacities, stresses, deflections, and other structural behaviors, verifying design adequacy and performance      Technical Drawings: Prepare detailed structural drawings, plans, and specifications using CAD (Computer-Aided Design) software, ensuring accuracy and clarity for construction purposes      Material Selection: Select appropriate construction materials, such as concrete, steel, timber, and composite materials, based on project requirements, structural performance criteria, and environmental factors      Code Compliance: Ensure compliance with relevant building codes, regulations, and standards (eg, ACI, AISC, ASCE, IBC) governing structural design, construction, and safety      Structural Analysis: Conduct structural analysis using finite element analysis (FEA) software, computational modeling techniques, and hand calculations to evaluate structural behavior under various loading conditions and assess design alternatives      Seismic Design: Incorporate seismic design principles and techniques into structural designs to mitigate the effects of earthquakes and other seismic events, ensuring structural resilience and safety      Construction Support: Provide technical support to construction teams during the construction phase, reviewing shop drawings, responding to RFIs (Requests for Information), and addressing field issues to ensure compliance with design intent and specifications      Quality Assurance: Conduct quality assurance reviews of structural designs, calculations, and documentation to ensure accuracy, completeness, and compliance with project requirements and industry standards

column2: As a Structural Design Engineer specializing in precast concrete, your role will involve designing, analyzing, and overseeing the construction of precast concrete structures. You will work closely with architects, drafters, and other engineering professionals to ensure the successful completion of projects.  Role & responsibilities  Your responsibilities will include: 1.  Structural Design:  Develop and analyze structural designs for precast concrete components and systems.?  Ensure designs comply with relevant building codes, standards, and regulations.  Use engineering software and tools to model and analyze structures for strength, stability, and safety. 2.  Precast Concrete Expertise:  Specialize in the design and detailing of precast concrete elements such as beams, columns, walls, and slabs.  Optimize designs for manufacturing efficiency and cost-effectiveness in precast production. 3.  Collaboration:  Work collaboratively with architects, drafters, and other engineering disciplines to integrate precast elements into overall building designs.  Communicate effectively with project teams to ensure design intent is maintained throughout construction. 4.  Quality Control:  Implement and oversee quality control processes for precast elements during manufacturing and construction phases.  Conduct inspections and evaluations to ensure compliance with design specifications. 5.  Project Management:  Assist in project management tasks and coordinating with construction teams.  Provide technical support and guidance during the construction phase. 6.  Innovation and Continuous Improvement:  Stay abreast of industry trends, new materials, and construction technologies related to precast concrete.  Propose and implement innovative solutions to enhance design efficiency and construction processes. 7.  Documentation:  Prepare detailed design drawings, specifications, and reports.  Maintain accurate and organized project documentation. 8.  Client Interaction:  Engage with clients to understand project requirements and address any design-related concerns.  Provide technical expertise and guidance in client meetings. Preferred candidate profile      Bachelor's or Master's degree in Civil or Structural Engineering.  Strong experience in structural design, particularly in precast concrete.  Proficiency in relevant engineering software (e.g., AutoCAD, tekla, etabs, safe). Perks and benefits

column2: Our Structural Design team is responsible for the design of project specific, offshore wind turbine towers and foundations, focusing on the primary (load carrying) structure.      The team handles not only the structural design, but also the drawings, production specifications, assesses any production deviations and is driving new technology developments in this field.      Design of offshore support structures is a multidisciplinary task in which we combine knowledge and understanding of the interplay between fields such as structural dynamics, hydrodynamics, geotechnics, (aeroelastic) loads analysis and production engineering. As such we are looking for people that have experience in (a selection of) these fields.     The team has a presence in Den Haag (NL), Hamburg (DE), Vejle (DK) and Bangalore (IN).     The current position is open for the Bangalore office. Occasional international travel may be involved for training and/or project meeting purposes.             Depending on your field(s) of expertise the job encompasses (part of) the following responsibilities:           Perform project specific tower structure design and optimization studies for commercial as well as R&D projects.         Point of contact within your project(s) regarding the tower design scope, from the sales phase through installation.         Detailed design and analysis of project specific tower structures, covering tower shells, flange connections, doorframe, and other details in accordance with eg, Eurocode/DNVGL standards.         Execution of detailed analytical and/or finite element analyses.         Regular alignment with design stakeholders, including sales, loads, tower design, project management, CAD design.         Delivery of documentation for certification of the support structure.         Support R&D projects to develop the next generation support structure design solutions.               What You Need To Make a Difference           A passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change.      ?       We are also looking for           You hold an MTech/ MSc/ PhD degree in aerospace, civil, mechanical engineering, or an equivalent field.         At least 3 years of proven, relevant, work experience is seen as an advantage.         It is considered beneficial when you have experience in the offshore (wind) industry, and you are familiar with relevant (offshore) design standards such as Eurocode, DNVGL, etc         Should be familiar with dynamic analysis of structure, fatigue analysis and fracture mechanics         You are skilled in finite element analysis, preferably using ANSYS APDL or Workbench.         It is paramount that you are proficient in English, both in reading and writing.         We are seeking a person with excellent communication and presentation skills.         You thrive in an international environment; our projects bring together various employee groups, nationalities, cultures, and authorities.         As a person you should be enthusiastic, decisive, self-starting, result-oriented, customer focused, resourceful, and creative.               In return of your commitment, we offer you            Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come.         A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy         Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality.         Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization.         Competitive Pension Scheme

This team at XS CAD delivers Architectural Design Development, Structural Design, Architectural & Pre-Construction 3D / BIM Documentation & Modelling services to architects, engineers, home-builders and contractors within the design and build environment.      XS CAD has had the privilege of delivering Architectural, Engineering & Construction Services for thousands of projects over the past 18 years including Retail Chains, Residential Structures, Hospitals, Airports, Stadia, Educational Institutes & Commercial Structures as well. Ability to understand various types of Structures and their Design requirements.      To work with the team and deliver the Structural Design Documentation projects within time,budget and quality that is desired. Your expertise and experience in civil engineering, particularly in bridge design, will be essential in leading projects and providing technical guidance to the engineering team. The Job responsibilities will include - Bridge Design  - Develop detailed bridge designs considering factors such as load bearing capacity ,traffic volume, environmental impact and aesthetics. Structural Analysis  - Conduct structural analysis and simulations to ensure the bridge's integrity and stability under various loads and conditions. Code Compliance - Ensure that bridge designs comply with relevant national and international standards and codes of practice. Technical Expertise : Demonstrate a deep understanding of civil engineering principles, structural analysis, and bridge design methodologies. Utilize software tools and perform complex calculations to assess structural integrity and stability. Budgeting  - Provide cost estimates and budget analysis for bridge design and construction projects. Collaboration : Collaborate with multi-disciplinary teams, including geotechnical engineers, transportation engineers, and environmental specialists, to integrate all aspects of bridge design and construction. Construction Support : Provide technical support during the construction phase of bridge projects. Address design-related queries, review shop drawings, and assist in resolving on-site engineering challenges . Safety Measures  - Implement safety measures and standards to protect workers and the public during construction and throughout the bridge's lifespan. Project Management  - Collaborate with project managers to create project plans, budgets  and timelines for bridge construction projects. Preferred candidate profile  -  1. More than six years of work experience in bridge design. 2. Should be well conversant with Indian codes and procedures for Bridge Designing. 3. Perks and benefits  - Best in the industry.

column2: Layout Design: Developing detailed and optimized layouts for various integrated circuits, ensuring they meet performance, power, and area specifications      This involves placing transistors, interconnects, and other components on the semiconductor substrate      Custom Layout: Designing custom layouts for specific circuits, which may include analog circuits, digital circuits, mixed-signal circuits, or radio-frequency (RF) circuits      Physical Verification: Conducting physical verification processes, such as design rule checking (DRC) and layout versus schematic (LVS) checks, to ensure that the layout adheres to fabrication rules and accurately reflects the intended schematic design      Technology Nodes: Working with advanced semiconductor manufacturing processes and technology nodes, which may involve sub-10nm processes, FinFET technology, or other cutting-edge techniques      CAD Tools: Proficiency in using Computer-Aided Design (CAD) tools and layout software for IC design, such as Cadence Virtuoso, Synopsys IC Compiler, or Mentor Graphics Calibre      Optimization: Optimizing layout designs for factors like power consumption, signal integrity, electromagnetic interference (EMI), and manufacturability

column2: The Structural Designer is an employee responsible to issue the execution documentation for the scope of the Structural department of the Energy Business of John Cockerill, mainly steel structure, casing/ducting, stack, insulation works. He/She assures the delivery on time of General Arrangement, manufacturing, and erection drawings according to the milestones defined by the execution Project Teams. He/She is particularly responsible to deliver his/her work in conformity with internal quality standards as defined in the QMS (quality management system) of the Energy Business of John Cockerill.                     The Structural Designer is responsible for the delivery of the execution documentation of the projects for the scope of the Structural Department under the hierarchical responsibility of the Structural Manager and the functional responsibility of the Structural Engineer with the following objectives:                         Respect of the Design Process as defined in the QMS of the Business,                     Technical conformity of the execution documentation to internal standards and contractual requirements,                      Supply of a fast and reliable service to the execution teams in order to respect the document and equipment contractual delivery schedules of projects.                           Key Responsibilities                       The duties of the Structural Designer are amongst others:                         Study of Inputs and other requirements                     Check the completeness of the inputs received from the Technical Project Manager in order to proceed to his/her work and if not, the RFI document should be created and send it to the concern person of the project.                     Issue the execution documentation (mainly all types of drawings) in compliance with internal standards and contractual requirements,                     Issue the execution documentation in compliance with administrative standards,                     Issue the reports like Assembly Part list (BOM), Material list (BOQ) & bolt list etc                      Issue and update the standard technical documentation of the Structural Department,                     Keep his/her competencies updated with regards to the needs of the Energy Sector,                     Be proactive in the continuous improvement and REX processes.                             Education & Experience                              2 to 5 years of     relevant experience within an engineering context.                     ITI or Diploma of Civil or Mechanical Engineering                               Background, Skills, and Competencies                           The Structural Designer has a specialist profile       .               He/She adheres to the essential values of John Cockerill:                     Human                     Committed                     Innovative                     Responsible                     Customer oriented                           His/Her soft skills are:                           Detailed focused                     Team spirit                     Information sharing                     Disciplined                     Creative                     Problem solving                     Internal service oriented                     Communication                     Cooperation                           His/Her technical skills are:                       2D CAD knowledge of AutoCAD                      Knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel, Access)                     Structural drawings (Steel structures, Ducting, Pipe supports & Insulation etc )                      Reports like Material lists (BOQ), Item list (BOM) & Bolt list etc                      Knowledge of mechanical properties of structural steel elements (ASTM and EN)                     Reading of technical documentation

column2: Role & responsibilities   Title : Tekla & CAD Technician Location : Mumbai Qualifications :  Associate degree or equivalent in architectural/electrical/structural/mechanical technology, drafting, or a related field.  Proven experience as a CAD technician, with a focus on Teklsand BIM projects.  Proficiency in Autodesk Tekla software, with a strong understanding of BIM principles, workflows, and best practices.  Solid knowledge of construction industry standards and codes.  Familiarity with other CAD software (AutoCAD, Navisworks) and visualization tools (SketchUp, 3ds Max) is a plus.  Professional certifications in Autodesk Tekla or BIM-related fields are a must. Job Responsibilities:  Develop detailed 2D and 3D models using Autodesk Tekla software, ensuring compliance with project specifications and standards.  Collaborate with architects, engineers, and other stakeholders to understand project requirements and translate them into accurate CAD/Tekla Model drawings.  Create and maintain a library of Tekla families, templates, and construction details to enhance productivity and consistency across projects.  Assist in the coordination and integration of various building systems (e.g., mechanical, electrical, plumbing) within the Tekla environment.  Conduct clash detection and resolve clashes within the BIM model to minimize conflicts and optimize design efficiency.  Generate construction documentation, including plans, elevations, sections, and schedules, with a focus on accuracy and clarity.  Review and mark up drawings for errors, omissions, and quality assurance, and make necessary revisions to ensure compliance with project requirements.  Stay updated with the latest Tekla software releases, tools, and industry trends, and provide recommendations for process improvements and workflow enhancements.  Collaborate with project teams to facilitate effective communication and coordination throughout the design and construction phases. Technical Skill Set Required:  Excellent technical knowledge and latest update of market  Knowledge of software required for designing  Complete awareness of safety standards, regulations as well as IS and International codes Personal/Behavioural Skill Set Required:  Self-starter, keen learner, time management skills  Personal Leadership and good team working skills  High standards of good professional ethics  Good communication skills  Ability to handle pressure and willingness to accept additional responsibilities Reports to: Head of the Department

column2: As a provider of structural engineering services to the built environment, Reci is committed to design excellence in technical solutions which combine innovation, imagination and best practices delivered to international standards.     Due to our continuing expansion, we now require an Associate Structural Engineer with experience on a variety of construction projects in India and the Middle East from our office in Mumbai.     Working with a technical team providing specialised services to our clients is a great opportunity to gain experience with an internationally renowned consultant, allowing the opportunity to work on large and small-scale projects, in India and abroad.     The Associate structural engineer is to provide advice and design support to the rest of the team. He/she is to manage effectively his/her team in terms of workload, identify any additional resources needed, and support the Director with management of the office.     In this capacity, the Associate structural engineer will represent Reci Engineering Pvt Ltd. on behalf of the company.       Key responsibilities:       Responsible for a large team within the office with multiple projects progressing simultaneously.         Oversee preparation of Concept and Preliminary designs.         Preparation of technical specifications.         Oversee arithmetical checks and independent design reviews of other engineers designs.         Responsible for the correctness and accuracy of own work and the work of his/her team.         Responsible for ensuring that engineering work is completed within the programme.         Give site backup on technical/design issues where required.         To continuously monitor the recent developments in the field of structural engineering, particularly the high-rise design by reviewing the publications, and codes of practice, attending seminars and publishing papers to promote their findings.         Assist the Director with other delegated duties such as resource allocation, recruitment, writing technical memos, identifying training needs and organising them, carrying out annual appraisals, etc.         Report to the Director on any significant changes made during designs or construction which would require additional fees.         Develop own Client relationships and secure repeat work where possible, actively seek new work from existing clients.         Liaise with local authorities and Clients.         Assist with the preparation of financial and technical offers as directed.         Responsible for mentoring and technical development of the team.         Commitment to CPD and self-learning including development of own preferred area of expertise.       Requirements:       Degree in Structural Engineering BE (Civil), M.E (Civil), BSc or MSc, Preferably Chartered Structural or Civil Engineer.         Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.         Ability to manage a group of project teams.         Minimum 12 years post-degree experience specifically in different forms of high-rise structures. Ability in all forms of high-rise and medium-rise structural design components         Strong communication and organisational skills.         Should be able to independently initiate viable concepts and preliminary designs, especially for tall buildings.         Principally aware of computer design packages such as ETABS, SAFE, Robot & Prokon.         Self-motivated and team player.         Familiar with Indian, British and American Codes of Practice, such as IS 456, IS 1893, IS 13920, IS 800, IS 16700, BS 8110, BS 5950, ACI 318, AISC and IBC.         Have a flexible attitude to both the type of work undertaken and the level of responsibility accepted.         Should be able to interface with Clients as and when required.         Preferably an Associate member of the Institution of Engineers (India) or Graduate member of the Institute of Structural Engineers (IStructE) or civil equivalent.

Job summary:         As a provider of structural engineering services to the built environment, RECI is committed to design excellence in technical solutions combining innovation, imagination and best practices delivered to international standards.     We require Structural Engineers to provide structural engineering expertise on projects in India and the Middle East from our office in Mumbai.     Working with a technical team providing specialised services to our clients, this is a great opportunity for a design engineer to gain additional and more senior experience interacting with renowned national and international consultants on exciting projects in India and abroad.         Key responsibilities:         Assist the Senior Engineer in preparing concept and preliminary designs.         Carry out structural design and prepare construction drawings to Indian, British and American Standards.         Coordinate with architects, building services engineers, and other structural engineers.         Prepare markups for CAD technicians and check drawings when completed.         Carry out arithmetical checks and independent design reviews of another engineer s design.         Responsible for the correctness and accuracy of own work and the work of allocated CAD technicians.         Ensure that allocated works are completed within a programme and allocated budget.         Ensure senior staff are kept informed of important and relevant service/design decisions and the objectives of the company and the client are achieved.         Give site backup on technical/design issues, where required.         Visit sites to address design-related issues as and when required.         Attend meetings with local authorities, and coordination meetings with other departments and Clients as and when required         Manage the statutory compliance of an organisation, and liaison with local authorities and government bodies.         Mentor and assist Graduate Engineers         Adhere to stated policies and procedures relating to health and safety and quality management.         Requirements:         Degree in civil engineering or Masters in structural engineering.         Member of the Institution of Engineers (India) or working towards chartered membership of the Institute of Structural Engineers (IStructE) or civil equivalent.         3 years post Masters or 5-year post Degree experience in structural analysis, design and some site supervision.         Competent in the use of software packages i.e. Etabs, Safe, Robot, Staad, Prokon and the Microsoft suite of products packages.         Familiar with Indian, British and American Codes of Practice, such as IS 456, IS 1893, IS 800, BS 8110, BS 5950, ACI 318, AISC and IBC.         Be commercially aware. Have a flexible attitude to both the type of work undertaken and the level of responsibility accepted.

column2: As a Structural Engineer, you will play a critical role in the design, analysis, and evaluation of various structures to ensure their safety, functionality, and compliance with relevant codes and regulations     Your expertise will be instrumental in developing innovative solutions for construction projects and providing technical support throughout the project lifecycle     You will collaborate with architects, construction teams, and other stakeholders to deliver high-quality structural designs and solutions       Key Responsibilities:       Design and analyze structures, such as buildings, bridges, dams, and other infrastructure, using engineering principles and software tools     Develop detailed structural drawings, plans, and specifications, adhering to project requirements and building codes     Conduct site investigations and assess existing structures to evaluate their condition and identify potential issues     Perform structural calculations and simulations to ensure the integrity and stability of designs under different loading conditions     Collaborate with architects and other engineering disciplines to integrate structural designs with overall project requirements     Review and approve structural drawings and plans prepared by drafters and junior engineers     Provide technical support during construction, including responding to site queries and conducting site inspections     Address design changes and modifications during the construction phase, ensuring they comply with structural requirements     Utilize computer-aided design (CAD) and structural analysis software to streamline the design process and enhance efficiency     Stay updated with advancements in structural engineering technology, codes, and industry best practices         Qualifications and Requirements:         Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering with a focus on Structural Engineering     A Master's degree is a plus     Proven experience as a Structural Engineer or in a similar role, with a track record of successful structural design projects     In-depth knowledge of structural engineering principles, building codes, and design standards     Proficiency in structural design and analysis software (eg, ETABS, SAP2000, STAAD.Pro)     Strong understanding of materials properties and their behavior under different loading conditions     Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills to address complex structural challenges     Detail-oriented with the ability to create accurate and precise engineering drawings and specifications     Effective communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with multidisciplinary teams and stakeholders     Familiarity with construction practices and project management concepts     Professional engineering license or relevant certifications are advantageous
column11: Structural Engineer (10+ year experience)

The Mumbai office is growing a full complement of professionals with expertise in in Structural, Civil, Architecture, Mechanical, Electrical engineering, Construction, and Project Management. ?Burns & McDonnell India is looking for an experienced and energetic candidate to join our Global Facilities Group in Mumbai office to lead and support Structural design activities involved projects mainly in USA. This candidate will lead design, planning and client coordination activities associated with various Aviation and Federal, commercial, manufacturing, foods, and mission critical projects ??Key Responsibilities: o Responsible for analysis and design of various super structures and foundations for industrial facilities, design of steel and concrete buildings. o Preparing detail design calculation report and reviewing the detail drawings and layout o Geotechnical report review, analysis and provide comments/clarifications o Review of equipment vendor drawings and fabrication drawings. o Capture internal client requirements and if needed, advise them regarding structural/civil systems/requirements available to meet their needs and comply with safety codes. o Coordinate with other disciplines, client(s) and other stake holder(s) to develop a clash free system design. o Responsible to manage the assigned scope within agreed schedule and budget. o Willing to advance in career by taking increased responsibilities on projects and organization. o Help in recruitment, development, and training of staff o Serves as technical advisor, provide senior level Inputs o A committed team player able to work on own initiative. o Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, strong Interpersonal skills o Good Communication skills (verbal & written) and ability to self-check and produce accurate work ??Tools: o Exposure to any design software/tool like STAAD Pro, Risa 3D, SAFE, ETABs, etc . o AutoCAD o Knowledge of Navisworks will be added advantage o Knowledge of REVIT (Structural) or TEKLA will be an added advantage. o Microsoft Office Tools ??MS Word, MS Excel, MS Power Point, Outlook, OneNote  - o Bachelor?? degree in Civil Engineering from a recognized institution. Masters in Structural Engineering an added advantage. o Good analytical and problem-solving skills o Minimum 11 to 14 years of working experience in Structural design for industrial facilities and building. o Understanding of codes and standards (IS, ASCE, ACI, IBC, AISC etc.) and its applicability for practical design of industrial facilities and buildings. o Dynamic personality, eager to learn and interested in a stable commitment.

column2: Building on our past.  Ready for the future              Worley is a global professional services company of energy,  chemicals and resources experts.  We partner with customers to deliver projects and create value over the life of their assets.  We re bridging two worlds,  moving towards more sustainable energy sources,  while helping to provide the energy,  chemicals and resources needed now.               We partner with our customers to deliver projects and create value over the life of their portfolio of assets.  We solve complex problems by finding integrated data-centric solutions from the first stages of consulting and engineering to installation and commissioning,  to the last stages of decommissioning and remediation.  Join us and help drive innovation and sustainability in our projects.                        Purpose                        As Senior Offshore Structural Engineer,  you will be responsible to perform structural engineering services that meet Worley',  its customers' and applicable regulatory specifications,  on time and within budget.                                       Responsibilities                                        Offshore Structural Engineering experience having worked on Topsides and Jackets (substructure) and have experience in FEED and detailed design of offshore structures.                               Perform structural engineering services that meet Worley',  its customers' and applicable regulatory specifications,  on time and within budget.                               Perform structural engineering services as a lead with little guidance such as: studies,  analyses and provide recommend actions/solutions; review existing reports/available data                              Detail designs and drawings,  specifications,  data,  calculations and report,  develop solutions to install/remove equipment with no crane access; perform structural analysis utilizing the SACS (analysis types include In         place,  loadout,  transportation,  installation) and develop local calculations to support the design.                               Communicate effectively with the structural engineering team and project stakeholders.                               Participate in relevant meetings,  prepare progress reports and follow required checking procedures.                               Ensure the project scope is clear and provide engineering estimates.                               Support junior personnel and workshare team within the structural engineering team.                               Identify issues and problems,  develop appropriate solutions,  and ask for assistance when required.                               Work with a team of designers to develop 3D model and drawings.                                       Ensure discipline technical work meet all health,  safety,  environmental,  and security requirements.

column2: Role & responsibilities     Carry out the design and analysis of tunnelling projects, including underground structures, caverns, and associated facilities. Conduct geotechnical investigations and analyses to assess ground conditions, rock mechanics, and soil properties for tunnel design and construction. Develop detailed engineering designs, drawings, and specifications for tunnel alignments, cross-sections, support systems, and lining structures. Utilize advanced engineering software and modelling tools for geotechnical and structural analysis, including finite element analysis (FEA) and numerical modelling. Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams, including geotechnical engineers, structural engineers, architects, and contractors, to optimize tunnel designs and construction methodologies. Perform risk assessments and mitigation strategies related to geotechnical hazards, ground stability, and geological uncertainties in tunnelling projects. Coordinate with regulatory authorities and stakeholders to obtain necessary approvals and permits for tunnelling projects, ensuring compliance with relevant codes and standards. Conduct field visits and site inspections to monitor construction progress, assess site conditions, and address any design-related issues or modifications.  Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in tunnel engineering, contributing to the continuous improvement of design processes and methodologies. Preferred candidate profile      Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering, Geotechnical Engineering, or related field and Master's degree in rock mechanics or tunnel engineering preferred. Minimum of 10 years of experience in tunnel engineering, with a focus on geotechnical design and analysis. Tunnels in urban setting is preferred (Road/Rail/Sewage etc) Strong understanding in geotechnical engineering principles, including soil mechanics, rock mechanics, and ground improvement techniques. Proficiency in structural engineering concepts and analysis, with experience in designing tunnel support systems, linings, and underground structures.  Solid understanding of engineering software such as PLAXIS, FLAC, MIDAS GTS, SAP2000, or similar tools for geotechnical and structural analysis.  Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex technical challenges in tunnelling projects.  Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with multidisciplinary teams and stakeholders.

column2: Are you our new Sr Engineer - Geotechnical? Are you motivated by creating sustainable change that benefits society and nature? Are you a curious and open-minded person? We invite you to bring your talent and professional interest in Bridges, Ports and Marine Engineering and Design into play as part of Ramboll?? international network of Ports and Marine Engineers. We are looking for people with enthusiasm and a good track record in forming part of a high-performing team to deliver a range of major projects with colleagues located in Germany and the rest of the Europe. To succeed in this role, you must have a B.Tech in Civil Engineering with practical experience in the delivery of ports and marine engineering solutions. An M.Tech degree in Geotechnical Engineering or a higher academic qualification would be advantageous, along with a track record of delivering marine structures design, and other allied structures. Could you be the next member of our Bridges & Civil Engineering Team in India and help guide the development of other like-minded engineers? If this sounds like you, or you??e curious to learn more, then this role could be the perfect opportunity. Join our REC team as our new Senior Engineer, Geotechnical , REC and work with us to close the gap to a sustainable future. ? Your new role As our new Senior Engineer - Geotechnical you will be part of a world class, innovation driven engineering design center owned by an independent trust and its employees. REC is a highly sophisticated center of engineering excellence. Working in partnership with all our established offices globally, the Ramboll Engineering Centre (REC) is a center for excellence in design by offering optimized solutions to the rest of the organization. Your key tasks and responsibilities will be: Geotechnical design and calculations, including stability, settlement, supported excavation, piles, pre-loading, stabilization, geogrid, loading berm, lightening, replacement of soil, ground water, frost heave, mass balance, jet grouting and more   Geotechnical project work in German and international marine and infrastructure projects, including ports, tunnels, dykes, landfills, roads, tramways, railroads, pipelines, wind parks, industrial facilities and more   3D/FE Modelling of geotechnical structures   Interpreting geotechnical investigation reports and using appropriate geotechnical / geological design parameters   Programming soil investigation programs   Reporting and preparing design drawings and project documentation   Cost analysis, GHG emissions and environmental impact estimations, and risk assessments   Project meetings, and communicating with clients and other designers   Utilize applicable national and international codes for geotechnical design   Make sure that projects meet legal guidelines   Actively participate in improving your skills, the team and the organization   This would be the main kind of task + 3D/ FE work Your new team ? You will be part of REC was established as a dedicated institution for creating the excellence centre in Ramboll. REC focusses on providing global expertise using local resources from India. Facilitates cooperation between India, business units in Europe and the Middle East specifically for the Buildings, Transport and Water sectors. This big team is divided into groups of dedicated personnel? working for structures in UK, Denmark, Sweden, Finland and Norway who sometimes also work across these boundaries. They are virtual team mates working on common projects, prime business units in the above countries being the ones who coordinate with the clients and other consultants as well as with REC to pass on the design solutions to the user. The wide range in type of projects vary from high rise structures, to precast, to post tensioning etc., for some regions to industrial structures depending on the country you are working for. The most attractive thing is in spite of the challenges of working across continents, because of the culture of planning ahead and ability to understand each other?? needs, everyone works in a peaceful and lively manner, enjoyment and empowerment being some of the Ramboll values About you From the moment you join Ramboll, we will support your personal and professional development so that you grow with the company. For this role, we believe your starting point is:   Must possess 4+ years hands-on design experience, including in the geotechnical design of infrastructure, marine infrastructure, residential and/or industrial projects   Experience with European design codes (Eurocodes) / German Codes (DIN) will be an added advantage   Candidates having experience in working with Multinational Companies / overseas will have an advantage   Proficiency in AutoCAD, Plaxis 2D/3D, GGU, GROUP or similar basic geotechnical software as well as Microsoft Office tools   Knowledge of 3D modelling software (e.g., Leapfrog, Civil 3D, Tekla Structures) and programming skills (e.g., Rhino/Grasshopper, Python/VBA) are of special interest   Knowledge of other applicable software (e.g., FLAC 2D/3D, UDEC 2D/3D, Mathcad) would be an advantage   Have good communication skills (spoken, written) in English and be able to collaborate on international projects   Prefferable to have German language skills (spoken, written, > B2) and be able to read and write project documentation   Should be a good team member and should coordinate with other team members and the project manager for a timely delivery of projects.
